perturbation.original_text: 3.3 Notwithstanding Customer's obligations pursuant to clauses 3.1 and 3.4, the first [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive] of each Forecast shall constitute a binding commitment of Customer to purchase the quantities of Products set forth in the relevant Forecast for such [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive] period. The Forecast for the period beyond this two (2) month period shall be non-binding except to the extent otherwise provided in clause 3.4. Only Purchase Orders as accepted by Philips, as set forth in clause 3.4 below, constitute an obligation for Philips to actually produce the so ordered Products and no quantities of Products in the Forecast provided by Customer shall constitute an accepted Purchase Order.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 Notwithstanding Customer's obligations pursuant to clauses 3.1 and 3.4, the first [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive] of each Forecast shall constitute a non-binding estimate of Customer's intentions to purchase the quantities of Products set forth in the relevant Forecast for such [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive] period. The Forecast for the period beyond this two (2) month period shall be binding on Customer's forecast, but non-binding on actual purchase volumes except to the extent otherwise provided in clause 3.4. Only Purchase Orders as accepted by Philips, as set forth in clause 3.4 below, constitute an obligation for Philips to actually produce the so ordered Products and no quantities of Products in the Forecast provided by Customer shall constitute an accepted Purchase Order.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states the first two months of the forecast are a 'binding commitment'. The modified version states the first two months are a 'non-binding estimate' while simultaneously stating forecasts are 'binding on Customer's forecast, but non-binding on actual purchase volumes'. This creates a contradiction regarding the enforceability of the forecast, making it unclear whether the customer is obligated to purchase the forecasted quantities.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1 Philips represents and warrants to Customer that all Products delivered and any services provided hereunder: i. conform to the Specifications on the Delivery Date [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive]; ii. unless otherwise agreed with Customer in writing, are new (do not contain any used or reconditioned parts or materials) and fit for the purposes for which they are intended; iii. are of sound workmanship, good quality and free from defects in construction, manufacture and material [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive]; iv. the manufacturing and shipment of the Product comply in all respects with applicable Laws, regulations, certification requirements, including health and safety standards and all other applicable regulatory requirements for the manufacture and shipment of Products; v. are free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and other Claims against title; and vii. comply in all respects with the terms of this Agreement and the applicable Purchase Orders.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 Philips represents and warrants to Customer that all Products delivered and any services provided hereunder: i. conform to the Specifications on the Delivery Date to a reasonable extent [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive]; ii. unless otherwise agreed with Customer in writing, are similar to new and are fit for the purposes for which they are intended to a reasonable extent; iii. are of acceptable workmanship, good quality and may contain minor defects in construction, manufacture and material [Redacted - Commercially Sensitive]; iv. the manufacturing and shipment of the Product substantially comply with applicable Laws, regulations, certification requirements, including health and safety standards and all other applicable regulatory requirements for the manufacture and shipment of Products; v. are free and clear of all known liens, encumbrances, and other Claims against title; and vii. comply in most respects with the terms of this Agreement and the applicable Purchase Orders.
perturbation.explanation: The original section provides clear and strict warranties that the products 'conform' to specifications, are 'new', and 'free from defects'. The modification introduces ambiguity by weakening these guarantees. 'Conform' becomes 'conform to a reasonable extent', 'new' becomes 'similar to new', 'free from defects' allows for 'minor defects', and 'comply in all respects' is watered down to 'comply in most respects' and 'substantially comply'. This creates conflicting interpretations as to the level of quality and adherence to standards Philips is bound to, potentially leading to disputes over product acceptance and warranty claims.

perturbation.original_text: 12.2 Customer, in its sole discretion, may terminate this Agreement, without cause, by providing six (6) months prior written notice to Philips. Philips may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect by written notice to Customer, should Customer not have filed with the specified bodies to transfer the applicable registrations within the time period specified in clause 2.3.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.2 Customer, in its sole discretion, may terminate this Agreement, without cause, by providing six (6) months prior written notice to Philips. Philips may terminate this Agreement with reasonable effect by written notice to Customer, should Customer not have substantially filed with the specified bodies to transfer the applicable registrations in a timely fashion specified in clause 2.3.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states that Philips can terminate with 'immediate effect' given certain circumstances. The modified version changes that to Philips terminating with 'reasonable effect', which introduces ambiguity about what constitutes 'reasonable' and how long the termination process will actually take. Simultaneously, the requirements of Philips is now 'substantially filed' and 'in a timely fashion' instead of the definitive requirements, creating a contradiction about the basis of the termination.
